content: hey there… designed by sarah punderson a quick beanie knit in the round from the bottom up this hat is inspired by jon giswold founder of knit in the pit originally a local knitting group which became global through zoom he started many messages to me with hey there… and then would ask how i was or ask if i could talk or any number of things but it turned out he did that with everyone he had the gift of making everyone feel like his best friend like you were seen and important he extended this focus and generosity to the wider community supporting hat not hate knit the rainbow and soap s a c k along with many other organizations i designed this hat with hat not hate and jon in mind he loved bulky yarn and seed stitch yarn lion brand yarns color made easy 100% content 247yds 200g color huckleberry 1skein of bulky weight yarn will make 3 hats each hat takes about 77yds or 62g needles & notions  16in circular needle us 10 5/6 5mm or 11/8mm whichever needle gives you gauge  extra needles to work top of hat although i managed last round with the 16in needle using it like a magic loop  1 large stitch marker  tapestry needle gauge 11 sts = 4in/10cm in stockinette stitch pattern size one size fits most  ribbing unstretched is 17in around  body is 20in around  height is 8 75in tall  to make a smaller or larger hat change the needle size  to make a taller hat add row to body instructions brim co 54sts pm and join to work in the round being careful not to twist stitches if using long tail cast on you need about 1 1/2yds for tail work k1 p1 rib for 8 rounds check stitch glossary body increase round kfb k to end of round 55sts next 3 rounds knit next 4 rounds work seed stitch *k1 p1* to the end of round 4 since you now have an odd number of stitches you can work k1 p1 continuously and create the seed stitch as you are knitting you should be knitting the purls from the round before and purling the knits from the round before to create a bumpy texture next 4 rounds knit next 4 rounds work seed stitch knit 1 round decrease rounds round 1 *k3 k2tog* repeat to end of round 44sts round 2 knit round 3 *k2 k2tog* repeat to end of round 33sts round 4 knit round 5 *k1 k2tog* repeat to end of round 22sts round 6 knit round 7 k2tog repeat to end of round 11sts finishing cut yarn and pull the tail through remaining stitches with a tapestry needle and pull tight i like to weave the yarn through the stitches one more time then bring the tail to the inside and do a couple of back stitches to lock the yarn weave in
